abstract.p: July 1 article in some copies about resignation of Raymond Lane, president of Oracle Corp, referred imprecisely to press reports that Oracle's software rival, Microsoft, had underwritten groups backing Microsoft's antitrust defense; error was repeated in Economic View column July 3

block.p: An article in some copies of Business Day on Saturday about the resignation of Raymond Lane, president of the Oracle Corporation, referred imprecisely to press reports that Oracle's software rival, Microsoft, had underwritten groups backing Microsoft's antitrust defense. The error was repeated on Sunday in the Economic View column in Money & Business, about the exchange of invective between Oracle and Microsoft. The accounts of Microsoft's financial support, in The New York Times, The Washington Post and The Wall Street Journal, focused on two groups that are now known to have been targets of an Oracle-sponsored investigation. But none of the newspapers have said the documents cited in their coverage came from the Oracle operation; they have not identified the sources of their information.
